availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Ulery (Bath County, Kentucky, farm hand and pvt 1oth KY Cav USA)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Ulery and Rachel Ulery. Resident of Bath County in 1850. Farmhand in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 8, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 91A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 152.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 254.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0104..
